name: Siavash Shahshahani

roles_affiliations: Professor Emeritus at Sharif University of Technology
Head of the Mathematics Department at Sharif University of Technology
Iran University of Science and Technology (Department of Physics)
structured_info.background: An Iranian mathematician born in Tehran in 1942/43. He earned a Bachelor's degree from the University of Tehran and PhDs in theoretical physics from MIT and mathematics from the University of California, Berkeley under Stephen Smale. His research spans Geometry, Topology, Differentiable Manifolds, and percolation theory, including work on second-order ordinary differential equations on manifolds. He has been involved in the development of Iran’s national internet infrastructure. Also known as Siavash Mirshams Shahshahani, and proficient in English, French, and Spanish.

summary: Siavash Shahshahani is a highly accomplished Iranian mathematician and theoretical physicist, currently a Professor Emeritus at Sharif University of Technology. He received doctorates from both MIT and UC Berkeley (under Stephen Smale) and has contributed significantly to fields like geometry, topology, and percolation theory. Beyond academia, he played a role in developing Iran’s national internet and is also a photographer.

name: Stephen Smale

structured_info.background: Stephen Smale is a mathematician affiliated with the University of California, Berkeley. He advised and supervised Siavash Shahshahani's PhD work there.

summary: Stephen Smale is a mathematician at the University of California, Berkeley, known for his work as a PhD advisor and supervisor, notably for Siavash Shahshahani.
